clinicalDescription: Overview: A change in skin to erythematous (red) to violaceous (purple) macules (flat lesions), papules (small raised lesions), plaques (flat topped raised lesions, larger than papules) or nodules. Can occur in cold exposure and has been seen in COVID-19 disease, particularly in children Presentation: Erythematous or violaceous lesions on the fingers and toes with abnormal sensation of itching, burning or pain Assessment: Evaluate for covid 19, inflammatory disease (sed rate, rheumatoid factor, ANA for lupus) Plan: If mediated by COVID-19 infection, supportive care including anticoagulation. If due to systemic lupus, treated with immune modulators. Prognosis: Self-limited when occuring during COVID-19 infection. Can become chronic and recurring if not due to COVID-19.
